page.title: 10A CHILD'S DAY IN BIGGIN HILL
page.content:
Life of an average 10 year old
At school a child is encouraged to make his own decisions. He must try to plan the day ahead to avoid wasting time deciding what topic to do next.As well as being independent he is encouraged to work in small groups at times, to use each others ideas, but not to copy.After sharing ideas they may work separately then come together again and discuss their work. If they finish their work they may be allowed to use a computer if available. There are many clubs inside and outside school such as football, netball and more. Games clubs are very popular. The libraries have a large choice of books, fiction and non-fiction. Notice boards are often seen in the school with work and information on them.
